SEARCH
Package server

Class ClientHandler

java.lang.Object
server.ClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ClientHandler extends Object implements Runnable
The ClientHandler object implements the Runnable abstract class. This is done in order to provide a separate runnable thread for each user that joins the server. This improves performance and also allows for greater flexibility.
Since:
2023-02

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientHandler

      public ClientHandler(Socket socket)
      Constructor of the ClientHandler object takes in the socket.
      Parameters:
      socket - server socket

  • Method Details

    • removeClientHandler

      public void removeClientHandler()
      The removeClientHandler method removes a given client from the server and the list of ClientHandlers.

    • broadcastMessage

      public void broadcastMessage(String message)
      The broadcastMessage method sends a message to every connected client of the server, including the one that sent it. This is mainly used when users leave and join.
      Parameters:
      message - message to send to all

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(String message)
      The sendMessage method sends a message to everyone but the client that sent it This is for more common "chatroom" like interactions.
      Parameters:
      message - message to send

    • sendMessage

      public void sendMessage(String message, String targetUser)
      This overloaded version of sendMessage allows a specific user to be targeted. The targeted user is the only one that will see the message.
      Parameters:
      message - message to send
      targetUser - user to send message to

    • writeMessage

      public void writeMessage(ClientHandler clientHandler, String message) throws IOException
      Writes a message to the a specified client via the bufferedWriter. It then adds a new line and flushes the buffer.
      Parameters:
      clientHandler - client handler
      message - message to send
      Throws:
      IOException
      IOException

    • run

      public void run()
      Implementing the run function from the abstract method runnable. While socket is connected it takes in a message from the reader and writes it to all clients, except the sender.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • close

      public void close()
      The close method first removes the client handler and then tries to close all resources used by that client. To prevent trying to close a null object each are checked before closing.

    • close

      public void close(IOException e)
      The close method first removes the client handler and then tries to close all resources used by that client. To prevent trying to close a null object each are checked before closing. This version of close also takes in a parameter of IOException in order to print out the error before closing the resources.
      Parameters:
      e - IO Exception

    • getClientUsername

      public String getClientUsername()
      Gets the client username.
      Returns:
      String

    • setClientUsername

      public void setClientUsername(String clientUsername)
      Sets the client username.
      Parameters:
      clientUsername - client username
